course_title: Freshmen Seminar in MESAS: The Indian Ocean
class_notes:
First class meeting is Monday, August 30th.


Description 
The Indian Ocean has been described as the 'most ancient' of oceans and a 'cradle of globalization.' This is because it witnessed some of the earliest human interactions with the marine environment, and because subsequently diverse peoples were mobilized to exploit its many resources for food and other products, to cross oceanic spaces, and to inhabit new parts of the globe.  Interconnected economies and cross-cultural encounters are part of the story of peoples and communities living around the ocean.  This seminar explores the intersection of geography and environment, history, society, economy and culture around the Ocean's shores, across its waters, and on its numerous islands.
Textbook
Edward Alpers, The Indian Ocean in World History.  Oxford University Press, 2014.  ISBN 978-0-19-533787-7.
Electronic access to this text is available through Woodruff Library.
